app.classes module¶

PyNMR, J.Maxwell 2020

class app.classes.Baseline(config, dict)[source]¶

Bases: object

Data object for baseline event.

Parameters

dict – Dict of all event attributes to add as attributes to this object.

class app.classes.Config(channel, settings)[source]¶

Bases: object

Contains all relevent settings data for NMR measurement

Parameters

  • channel – Dict of current channel setting, selected from config file

  • settings – Dict of settings from config file

channel¶

Dict of channel settings; keys are species, cent_freq, mod_freq, power

controls¶

Dict of ConfigItems for controls

freq_list¶

1D Numpy array of frequency points in sweep as a float, in MHz

freq_bytes¶

List of frequency steps, as bytes of 16 bit binary word for R&S: https://www.rohde-schwarz.com/webhelp/sma100a_webhelp_1/Content/fb359696521a42fa.htm

class app.classes.ConfigItem(value, text, valid)[source]¶

Bases: object

Single configurable item with validator

Parameters

  • value – Value of item

  • text – Text string describing item for label

  • valid – QValidator object for the value string

set_config(value)[source]¶

Change config settings to those in the LineEdit boxes, changing string to correct type based on validator

Parameters

value – Value to change the config item to.

class app.classes.Event(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Data and method object for single event point. Takes config instance on init.

Parameters

config – Config class instance

config¶

Config object for the event

scan¶

Scan object for the event

start_time¶

Datetime object for time event started accumulating measurements

start_stamp¶

Timestamp int for starting datetime

stop_time¶

Datetime object for time event stopped accumulating measurements

stop_stamp¶

Timestamp int for stop datetime

basesweep¶

Baseline phase sweep list

basesub¶

Baseline subtracted phase sweep list for event

polysub¶

Polyfit subtracted basesub list

wings¶

Portion of sweep to use for fit, 4 long list giving position of left start, left stop, right start and right stop positions as a decimal from 0 to 1

cc¶

Calibration constant float

area¶

Area under polyfit curve float

pol¶

Measured polarization for event, CC*Area, float

base_time¶

Datetime object for stop of baseline event

base_stamp¶

Timestamp int of baseline event

base_file¶

Filename string where baseline event can be found

close_event(epics_reads, eventfile)[source]¶

Closes event, calls fits and plots, writes to disk, history and EPICS

Parameters

eventfile – File object to write event to

fit_wings(wings, sweep)[source]¶

Fit to wings with scipy

Parameters

  • wings – Wings, 4 element list of portions of sweep to use, attribute from Config

  • sweep – List of samples to fit

Returns

Tuple of final fit coefficient list

Return type

pf

poly(p, x)[source]¶

Third order polynomial for fitting

Parameters

  • p – List of polynomial coefficients

  • x – Sample point

print_event(eventfile)[source]¶

Print out event to eventfile, formatting to dict to write to json line.

Parameters

eventfile – File object to write event to

update_event(new_sigs)[source]¶

Method to update event with new signal chunk

Parameters

new_sigs – tuple of number of sweeps in the chunk, new phase data list and new diode data list

class app.classes.RunningScan(config, to_avg)[source]¶

Bases: object

Data object for averaged set of sweeps, with method to perform running average.

Parameters

  • config – Config object for scan

  • to_avg – Number of sweeps to keep in running average

freq_list¶

Frequency points of sweep in MHz, from config

phase¶

List of measurements at each frequency points for the phase

diode¶

List of measurements at each frequency points for the diode

points_in¶

Number of sweeps currently in the average

running_avg(new_sigs)[source]¶

Performs running average for tuning

Parameters

new_sigs – tuple of number of sweeps in the chunk, new phase data list and new diode data list

app.gui module¶

PyNMR, J.Maxwell 2020

class app.gui.MainWindow(parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QMainWindow

Main window of application, with all the utility gui tabs. Includes methods for starting Event, Base instances. Event and Baselines are attributes, so that all child tabs can access. Many attributes concern the GUI, the attributes that effect operation are listed.

config¶

Current Config configuration instance

event¶

Current Event instance

baseline¶

Current Baseline instance

epics¶

Open EPICS connection

history¶

History instance containing set of HistPoints

eventfile¶

Current event data filehandle

eventfile_start¶

String of eventfile start time

eventfile_lines¶

Number of entries in current eventfile

channels¶

List of channels from config file

settings¶

Dict of settings from config file

epics_reads¶

Dict keyed on epics channels with name strings

epics_writes¶

Dict keyed on epics channels with Event attributes to send

run()[source]¶

Main run loop. Request start of sweeps, receive sweeps, update event, report.

Returns

On completion of a chunk, emits new_sigs, the number of sweeps in the chunk and the phase and diode chunk data as numpy arrays

app.epics module¶

PyNMR, J.Maxwell 2020

class app.epics.EPICS(test_mode, read_names, write_atts)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to hold all EPICS channels to monitor and write, and methods on them. Includes test mode which is used if test_chan get returns None. All channels are using Process Variables, which allow direct access without using a caget or caput. For example:

p1 = PV(‘chan’) print(p1.value) # this is a get p1.value = 2.0 # this is a put

Parameters

  • test_chan – Name of EPICS channel to test to see if the connection is working, otherwise use test mode

  • read_names – Dict of channel names string to read keyed on epics channel ie ‘HBPT:targ_pol’

  • write_atts – Dict of Event attributes to write keyed on epics channel

read_all()[source]¶

Read new values from EPICS PVs

Returns

Dict of values keyed on channel name

write_all(event)[source]¶

Write all new values to EPICS PVs

Parameters

event – Event class instance with values to write

app.te_calc module¶

J.Maxwell 2020

class app.te_calc.TE(species, field, areas, temps)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to perform TE measurements, output results. Ignores error in CC due to error in temp, as the contribution to delta CC from delta t is suppressed by 1/pol^2, and pol is small.

Parameters

  • species – Nuclear species string, proton or deuteron. Looks for p or d to select which, so flexible on the string provided

  • field – field value float in Tesla

  • areas – 1-D numpy array with areas

  • temps – 1-D numpy array with temps

field¶

magnetic field used for calculation

num¶

number of points in the measurements

cc¶

averaged calibration constant from points

cc_std¶

standard deviation of calibation constant from points

te_pol¶

averaged polarization during TE

te_pol_std¶

standard deviation of polarizations

temp¶

averaged temperature during TE

temp_std¶

standard deviation of temperatures

area¶

averaged area during TE

area_std¶

standard deviation of areas

pretty_te()[source]¶

Return formated string short version of TE report

print_te()[source]¶

Print long version of TE report to JSON file

app.daq module¶

PyNMR, J.Maxwell 2020

class app.daq.DAQConnection(config, timeout, tune_mode)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handle connection to and communication with DAQ system. Designed to hide all the specifics of different DAQ systems with generic actions for all. Init will open connections and send configuration settings to DAQ.

Parameters

  • config – Config object with settings

  • timeout – Timeout for DAQ system

  • tune_mode – Use tune mode, with only one chuck

get_chunk()[source]¶

Receive subset of total sweeps for the event

start_sweeps()[source]¶

Send command to sending NMR sweeps
